transfer.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization
transfer.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Swod transferred from MI6 to the Security Service.
They’re transferring him to a special unit at Great Ormond Street Hospital.
You’ll be transferred to the Birmingham office.
transfer.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to move from one place to another, or to move something from one place to another
transfer.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The exhibition transfers to York City Art Gallery on 23rd January.
Transfer the meat to warm plates.
transfer.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to sell a sports player to another team
transfer.translation[0].definitions[2].e: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
transfer.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to move money from one account or institution to another
transfer.translation[0].definitions[3].e: I’d like to transfer $500 to my checking account.
transfer.translation[0].definitions[4].d: if a skill, idea, or quality transfers from one situation to another, or if you transfer it, it can be used in the new situation
transfer.translation[0].definitions[4].e: Ideas that work well in one school often don’t transfer well to another.
transfer.translation[0].definitions[5].d: to connect the call of someone who has telephoned you to someone else’s telephone so that that person can speak to them
transfer.translation[0].definitions[5].e: Hold on one moment while I transfer your call.
transfer.translation[0].definitions[6].d: to officially give property or land to someone else
transfer.translation[0].definitions[7].d: to change from one bus, plane etc to another while you are travelling, or arrange for someone to do this
transfer.translation[0].definitions[7].e: You will be met on arrival at the airport and transferred to your hotel.
transfer.translation[0].definitions[8].d: to copy recorded information, music etc from one system to another
transfer.translation[0].definitions[8].e: Transfer the files onto a memory stick.
transfer.translation[0].definitions[9].d: if a disease is transferred from one person or animal to another, the second person or animal begins to have the disease
transfer.translation[0].definitions[9].e: It is unlikely that the disease will be transferred from animals to humans.
transfer.translation[1].definitions[0].d: the process by which someone or something moves or is moved from one place, job etc to another
transfer.translation[1].definitions[0].e: the transfer of assets within a group of companies
Penny’s applied for a transfer to head office.
transfer.translation[1].definitions[1].d: someone or something that has been moved in this way
transfer.translation[1].definitions[2].d: the act of changing from one bus, aircraft etc to another while travelling
transfer.translation[1].definitions[2].e: Getting there often means a couple of transfers on a bus line.
transfer.translation[1].definitions[3].d: a drawing, pattern etc that can be stuck or printed onto a surface
transfer.translation[1].definitions[4].d: a ticket that allows a passenger to change from one bus, train etc to another without paying more money
transfer.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to move money or investments from one account or institution to another
transfer.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Customers cantransfer money instantly, using the bank’s automated machines.
One reason investors transfer annuities is to get a higher level of benefit.
transfer.translation[2].definitions[1].d: to move something from one place or position to another
transfer.translation[2].definitions[1].e: Production from both units will be transferred to other centres.
Brazil is in the process of transferring its state-owned mills to private ownership.
transfer.translation[2].definitions[2].d: to move from one place or job to another, or to arrange for someone to do this
transfer.translation[2].definitions[2].e: The company transferred hundreds of jobs to Mexico.
Ms. Martin transferred from Houston to her current job in Los Angeles after being promised promotion.
transfer.translation[2].definitions[3].d: to pass a telephone call from one telephone to another, or computer files from one computer to another
transfer.translation[2].definitions[3].e: Hold on, let me transfer you.
The technology will be very useful to companies that routinelytransfer documents electronically.
transfer.translation[3].definitions[0].d: the process by which someone or something is moved from one place or position to another
transfer.translation[3].definitions[0].e: The cuts will be achieved through a combination of layoffs, retirements andjob transfers.
transfer.translation[3].definitions[1].d: a change in the ownership of money, property etc from one person or organization to another, or the arrangements for doing this
transfer.translation[3].definitions[1].e: The legal environment forshare transfers in Russia is still unclear.
The Land Registry records everyproperty transfer.
